title: Cards
description: Explore and implement various card styles, including small, large and image cards.
content:
This section introduces the different card styles available in the system, from compact small cards to visually rich image cards. Each example is paired with JSX code snippets, providing you with a practical guide to incorporate these components seamlessly into your project.

## Small Card

```jsx
<CardGrid>
  <Card
    title="Instructions"
    href="/docs/basic-setup/installation"
    icon="alignJustify"
    variant="small"
    description="test description"
  />
  <Card
    title="Setup"
    href="/docs/basic-setup/setup"
    icon="alignJustify"
    variant="small"
  />
  <Card
    title="Rubix Studios"
    href="https://rubixstudios.com.au"
    icon="alignJustify"
    external={true}
    variant="small"
  />
</CardGrid>
```

## Large Card

```jsx
<CardGrid>
  <Card
    subtitle="Instructions"
    title="Installation"
    description="Get started with Documents using our quick start installation guide to get your project started."
    href="/docs/basic-setup/installation"
  />
  <Card
    subtitle="Setup"
    title="Site Settings"
    description="Setting up your Documents projects layout, links and search engine optimisation."
    href="/docs/basic-setup/setup"
  />
  <Card
    subtitle="Support"
    title="Rubix Studios"
    description="Australia's leading branding, marketing and web development company."
    href="https://rubixstudios.com.au"
    external={true}
  />
</CardGrid>
```

## Image Card

```jsx
<CardGrid>
  <Card
    title="Instructions"
    href="/docs/introduction/installation"
    image="/images/og-image.png"
    variant="image"
  />
  <Card
    title="Setup"
    href="/docs/introduction/setup"
    image="/images/og-image.png"
    variant="image"
  />
  <Card
    title="Rubix Studios"
    href="https://www.rubixstudios.com.au"
    image="/images/og-image.png"
    external={true}
    variant="image"
  />
</CardGrid>
```

title: Filetree
description: This section provides an overview of file structures and their implementation using the FileTree component.
content:
This section demonstrates the structure of a file tree using the `FileTree` component. Below is an example showcasing folders and files organized hierarchically for a project setup.

## How to Use

Integrate the `FileTree` component into your project to visually represent file and folder structures. This is particularly useful for documentation, tutorials, or providing users with an overview of your project's architecture.

### JSX Code Example

Here is how you can define the file tree structure in for use in your project:

```jsx
<FileTree>
  <Folder name="src" label="Source Code">
    <File name="index.tsx" label="Index File" />
    <Folder name="components" label="Components">
      <File name="button.tsx" label="Button Component" />
      <File name="input.tsx" label="Input Component" />
    </Folder>
    <Folder name="pages" label="Pages">
      <File name="home.tsx" label="Home Page" />
      <File name="about.tsx" label="About Page" />
    </Folder>
  </Folder>
</FileTree>
```

Use this code as a template to set up your own file tree structure and customize it as needed.

title: Setup
description: Setting up and configuring your documentation project
content:
Setting up your new documentation project is straightforward. Most of the essential project settings can be configured within the `settings` folder.

## AGENT CONFIGURATION

This section provides the core settings for your documentation site, such as defining the site's URL, site icon and title.

```tsx showLineNumbers
export const url = ""                 // The URL for your documentation site
export const siteicon = ""            // Icon displayed next to the site name in the header
export const sitename = ""            // Title of your documentation site
```

## Google Tags

This section allows you to integrate Google Tag Manager into your documentation project. You can add your GTM code and configure whether it's connected.

```tsx showLineNumbers
export const gtm = ""                 // Add your Google Tag Manager code here
export const gtmconnected = true      // Set to true if GTM is connected, otherwise set to false
```

## Search Engine

Configure essential SEO settings to ensure your documentation site is optimized for search engines. This includes meta descriptions, keywords and social media sharing details like images and alt text.

```tsx showLineNumbers
export const description = ""         // Description of your documentation site for SEO
export const keywords = ["", ""]      // List of SEO keywords for your documentation site
export const urlimage = ""            // The URL of the image used when sharing on social media)
export const imagealt = ""            // Alt text for shared images, helpful for screen readers
export const twitterhandle = ""       // Your company’s Twitter handle for social sharing
```

## Footer Branding

The footer settings allow you to customize the company information displayed at the bottom of the site. You can add the company name and the URL that the name will link to.

```tsx showLineNumbers
export const companyname = ""         // The company name displayed in the copyright section
export const companylink = ""         // The URL your company name should link to
```

## General Layout

The layout settings control the appearance and functionality of various elements of the documentation site, such as branding, the right sidebar, feedback options, table of contents, and scroll-to-top functionality.

```tsx showLineNumbers
export const branding = true          // Set to true to display our branding elements
export const rightsidebar = true      // Set to true to enable the right sidebar with feedback, table of contents and scroll-to-top
export const feedbackedit = true      // Control to enable/disable feedback on GitHub
export const tableofcontent = true    // Control to enable/disable the generated table of contents
export const totopscroll = true       // Control to enable/disable scroll-to-top button
```

## Github Control

If your MDX files are hosted on GitHub, you can configure the project to load documents directly from there. This option can be useful for syncing documentation updates directly with your repository.

```tsx showLineNumbers
export const loadfromgithub = false   // Set to true to load your MDX documents directly from GitHub
```

## Project Structure

title: Introduction
description: This section provides an overview of how to get started with the Strategic Machines AI Voice Agent Platform.
content:
## Voice Platform for Business

VOX (Latin for Voice or Expression) is a multi-tenant voice agent platform for building production-ready voice experiences — from product sales and fulfillment to reservations and customer support — grounded in your real business data. You define **how the agent behaves** (prompt + dialog flow), **what it can say** (your data as context), **what it can do** (tools), and **what it can show** (UI components). The platform handles the runtime: session creation, safety controls, tool execution, and consistent rendering of results.

## Documents

## Core Business Features

| Business Capability | What it delivers | Business impact |
|---------------------|------------------|-----------------|
| **24×7 Customer Coverage** | Voice agents are always available to answer questions, take requests, and complete transactions without staffing constraints. | Improves customer satisfaction while reducing after-hours staffing costs and missed opportunities. |
| **Higher Conversion and Sales Enablement** | Agents actively guide customers through product discovery, availability, and booking or purchase flows. | Increases conversion rates and average order value by assisting customers at the moment of intent. |
| **Faster Customer Resolution** | Agents instantly retrieve accurate information about orders, inventory, reservations, and policies. | Reduces wait times, lowers support tickets, and improves first-contact resolution. |
| **Consistent Brand Representation** | Agents follow defined tone, messaging, and behavior aligned to your brand voice and service standards. | Protects brand reputation and ensures uniform customer experiences across channels. |
| **Scalable Customer Engagement** | One platform supports thousands of simultaneous conversations without service degradation. | Enables growth without proportional increases in headcount or infrastructure cost. |
| **Employee Productivity Assistants** | Internal agents help staff find answers, search products, check availability, and complete routine tasks. | Frees employees to focus on higher-value work and reduces onboarding and training time. |
| **Revenue-Generating Service Automation** | Agents can complete bookings, schedule appointments, process payments, and capture qualified leads. | Turns customer service into a profit center instead of a cost center. |
| **Personalized, Context-Aware Interactions** | Agents tailor responses using customer context, history, and real-time business data. | Creates more relevant conversations that build trust and improve loyalty. |
| **Rapid Time-to-Value** | New agents, workflows, and offers can be launched and updated quickly without major system changes. | Allows marketing and operations teams to respond faster to market opportunities. |
| **Enterprise-grade Reliability and Cost Controls** | Built-in safeguards manage usage, prevent abuse, and keep spending within defined limits. | Protects margins and ensures predictable operating costs as usage scales. |
| **Monitored** | All conversations are monitored, and escalated for 'human in the loop' intervention where required. | Excellent customer care and responsiveness. |
| **Secure** | With our powerful tool sets, data and configurations are managed through your set of APIs | Your data. Protected. |

## Core Technical Features

| Feature | What it provides | Why it matters in production |
|--------|------------------|------------------------------|
| **Data-grounded conversations** | Agents retrieve real-time, structured JSON from your systems via tools (availability, inventory, orders, events, pricing). | Prevents hallucinations and ensures answers reflect current business reality. |
| **HTTP Tool Descriptors (schema-driven)** | Declarative JSON schema for methods, parameters, auth headers, URL/body templates, and timeouts. | Standardizes every integration and avoids one-off runtime code per API. |
| **Declarative UI rendering** | Tools can declare UI actions on success/error (catalogs, confirmations, payment forms, media galleries). | Turns API responses into consistent customer experiences automatically. |
| **Built-in core tools** | Platform utilities like time checks, website scraping, opening links, clipboard copy, and component rendering. | Accelerates your Agent design and configuration without custom setup for common tasks. |
| **Prompt-driven workflows** | System prompt defines tone, guardrails, tool triggers, dialog flow, and response templates. | Keeps behavior predictable and auditable across updates and versions. |
| **Strong templating + typing rules** | Stable execution context (`args`, `response`, `status`, `secrets`) with filters for numbers, booleans, currency, and JSON objects. | Prevents integration bugs such as stringified numbers or broken UI props. |
| **Multi-tenant configuration model** | Tenants, agents, widget keys, origins, limits, and API secrets are centrally managed. | Enables secure isolation and scalable onboarding of many customers. |
| **Layered security & abuse protection** | Edge + server rate limits, bot verification, session quotas, duration and idle caps, daily spend limits. | Protects reliability and cost without disrupting real users. |
| **Session observability & lifecycle control** | Realtime session records, heartbeats, stale detection, and mid-session termination. | Keeps dashboards accurate and prevents runaway sessions. |
| **Fast test-and-iterate loop** | Start agents instantly, inspect tool calls, validate APIs, and refine prompts. | Shortens feedback cycles and de-risks production launches. |

## How the platform fits together

* **Agent** — personality, guardrails, and workflow (prompt)
* **Tools** — what the agent can do (HTTP descriptors calling your APIs)
* **Data** — what the agent knows (structured JSON returned by your systems)
* **UI Components** — what the agent can show (forms, confirmations, galleries, results)
* **Tenant Configuration** — who can use it and where (tenantId, widget keys, origins, limits)

This model keeps your voice experience grounded, secure, and maintainable—while staying flexible enough for bookings, commerce, scheduling, and support across different businesses.

title: Changelog
description: Changelogs and improvements to the Documents projects.
content:
## Added

**Linting and Formatting**:

* Added `pnpm run lint` and `pnpm run lint:fix` scripts to automate linting tasks.
* Added `pnpm run format` and `pnpm run format:check` scripts to ensure consistent code formatting.

**SEO Enhancements**:

* Added an SEO component to MDX pages to dynamically include `keywords` and `lastModified` metadata for improved SEO generation.

## Updated

**Next.js Upgrade**:

* Upgraded the project from **Next.js 14** to **Next.js 15**, leveraging the latest features and performance improvements.

**Codebase Improvements**:

* Reordered imports across the project files for better consistency and readability.

**Mermaid Component**:

* Fixed an ID bug that caused rendering issues when multiple Mermaid diagrams were included in MDX pages.
* Improved initialization and rendering logic to prevent duplicate diagram rendering.
